review: This really is easy to setup and use. My Vizio TV has an HDMI port next to a USB port; so, the Roku and it's power source (via a USB  cable) connect without adding more wires behind the TV. The one thing that is missing is an Ethernet input. Connecting this device behind a TV may block its access to a WiFi signal and render it useless. I had to move an access point in order to connect.

review: I have actually gotten 2 of these as gifts for other people. This was the first refurbished one and it works exactly like the new one I bought.I love the ROKU stick, you just have to understand what you're getting.  If your wireless internet isn't that great, then you may want to get a Roku that can hard-wire into Ethernet.  People who complain about not getting any "bars" must have wifi problems anyway.  This ROKU picks up wireless as well as my laptop and even better than my iphone sometimes.The other thing people complain about is this ROKU is slower than others.  Well it kind of is, sometimes. It takes forever to turn on. I recommend plugging the power into the wall, even though it seems cool and convenient to plus it into your TVs usb port (unless your usb port is powered even when you tv is turned off).  Otherwise the roku turns off every time your tv is turned off and on when it's turned on.  For every other ROKU they just recommend you leave it on all basically all the time.People also say that Netflix takes forever to load on the stick, which is also basically true.  The first time you load netflix after the roku is turned on Netflix will take a long time, like seriously maybe a minute to finally load.  But the good thing is once you've loaded it once it opens pretty much instantly (until of course you restart the roku which is another reason to plug it into the wall).The Netflix interface is just like the ROKU 3 and is much nicer than the older models, however, I believe this roku has pretty much the same processor as the old models so with the new Netflix interface things can sometimes be a little sluggish.  But I think it's worth it.  It really looks much nicer than the old ROKUs.  Every other channel loads in about the same time as an older model.If it's speed you're after there is no ROKU that will beat the 3, but this little guy is pretty awesome if you want to pay half the price and are a little more patient :)
